an6.68:4.1: “Mendicants, it’s totally impossible that a mendicant who enjoys company and groups, who loves them and likes to enjoy them, should take pleasure in being alone in seclusion.
an6.68:4.2: Without taking pleasure in in being alone in seclusion, it’s impossible to learn the characteristics of the mind.
an6.68:4.3: Without learning the characteristics of the mind, it’s impossible to fulfill right view.
an6.68:4.4: Without fulfilling right view, it’s impossible to fulfill right samādhi.
an6.68:4.5: Without fulfilling right samādhi, it’s impossible to give up the fetters.
an6.68:4.6: Without giving up the fetters, it’s impossible to realize extinguishment.
an6.68:5.1: It’s totally possible that a mendicant who doesn’t enjoy company and groups, who doesn’t love them and like to enjoy them, should take pleasure in being alone in seclusion.
an6.68:5.2: For someone who takes pleasure in being alone in seclusion, it’s possible to learn the characteristics of the mind.
an6.68:5.3: For someone who learns the characteristics of the mind, it’s possible to fulfill right view.
an6.68:5.4: Having fulfilled right view, it’s possible to fulfill right samādhi.
an6.68:5.5: Having fulfilled right samādhi, it’s possible to give up the fetters.
an6.68:5.6: Having given up the fetters, it’s possible to realize extinguishment.”
